title: Ticket #2969: The Directory object can't handle long paths on Windows
description:
The condor directory object uses the Ansi entry points for the Windows API's. These entry points can't deal with paths > 260 characters. Among other problems, this can allow condor externals builds in the batlab (running under cygwin) to set ACLs on file objects that the condor directory object was unable to remove, and thus unable to delete the execute directory.

The condor_rmdir tool provides a workaround for this problem, but the real fix is to change the directory object to use the Unicode version of the Windows APIs.
